intro: Pinckneya pubescens, commonly known as the hairy pinckneya, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Pinckneya pubescens is often found in moist, wooded areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
